column4: I love linux, but I seem to find some issue with every distro that I have. Then again, I have only been using linux for a few months. I do hope to abandon windows once I can find a distro that can work properly with my hardware. So far, abuntu is the closest
well, my video card works fine in suse, but my sound card does not
my sound card works great in ubuntu
but not my resolution
what video card?
to get higher res you need the binary driver the nv driver doesn't really support high resolutions
the resolution problem probably has to do with xorg autodetection you might have to add the resolution to your xorg.conf
and restarted gdm and X?
see I don't even mess with the window managers resolution thing since usually they onyl show like five resolutions
can you pastebin your xorg.conf
you paste in a pastebin
yeha that's how I do it it seems to work better
you can if you want to
yes you have to restart
it's has a menu at the bottom which will show you the commands to save and such
did you do sudo nano /boot/grub/menu.lst
umm it should have opened up your menu.lst
it's l such as L not 1
yes
have to save
eye candy it gets lame after a while
